snippet: Though banned in China, paying for positive news coverage is so widespread that many publications and broadcasters have rate cards listing prices.
abstract: Paying for positive news coverage in China is so widespread that many publications and broadcasters have rate cards listing prices, despite laws and regulations that ban paid promotional material that is not labeled as such; not all business and company profiles in Chinese media are paid for, but even when they are not, media organizations often have much laxer rules than many mainstream Western journalists for accepting payments from sources for news coverage.

byline.contributor: Gu Huini and Xu Yan contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Though banned in China, paying for positive news coverage is so widespread that many publications and broadcasters have rate cards listing prices.

headline.seo: Flattering News Coverage Has a Price in China
headline.main: In China Press, Best Coverage Cash Can Buy
